Article Title: India match schedule for T20 World Cup: All India upcoming matches, timings, venues
Article Text:
PTI Photo

Special dinner for Team India at Gautam Gambhir’s house in Delhi | T20 World Cup

Match Team vs Team Result Venue Date Match 1 India vs USA India won by 29 runs Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai Sat, Feb 7, 2026 Match 2 India vs Namibia Yet to be played Arun Jaitley Stadium, Delhi Thu, Feb 12, 2026 Match 3 India vs Pakistan Yet to be played R. Premadasa Stadium, Colombo Sun, Feb 15, 2026 Match 4 India vs Netherlands Yet to be played Narendra Modi Stadium, Ahmedabad Wed, Feb 18, 2026

Team India, under the leadership of Suryakumar Yadav , began their T20 World Cup 2026 campaign on a winning note, defeating the United States of America by 29 runs at the Wankhede Stadium on Saturday.The Men in Blue will next face Namibia on Thursday at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi. That will be followed by a marquee showdown against arch-rivals Pakistan on Sunday, February 15. The much-anticipated clash is set to take place at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo and is expected to be one of the highlights of the group stage.India will wrap up their Group A fixtures with a match against the Netherlands on February 18 at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.As defending champions, India enter the tournament with a chance to achieve something truly special. In a format where supremacy is often short-lived and margins razor-thin, the team has an opportunity to defend a men’s T20 World Cup title — an achievement that would further strengthen their legacy in the shortest format. India are also aiming to become the first nation to lift the T20 World Cup trophy on home soil.A successful campaign would also make India the first team to win the men’s T20 World Cup three times.India’s journey in the tournament began with glory in the inaugural edition in 2007, when they defeated Pakistan in the final at the New Wanderers Stadium in Johannesburg under the captaincy of Mahendra Singh Dhoni. That iconic triumph laid the foundation for India’s dominance in T20 cricket.The second title, however, came after a long wait. Seventeen years later, India returned to the summit in 2024, with Rohit Sharma leading the side to a memorable title win. India edged past South Africa in a thrilling final to finally end their prolonged title drought.Now, with momentum on their side, India will look to script another historic chapter in T20 World Cup history.
Article Summary: India begin their t20 world cup 2026 campaign against usa on saturday. The men in blue will next face namibia on thursday at the arun jaitley stadium in delhi. That will be followed by a marquee showdown against arch-rivals pakistan on february 15.

Article Title: Chloe Kim moved to tears by Myles Garrett’s poem as couple’s rising romance becomes one of sports world’s sweetest real stories
Article Text:
Chloe Kim moved to tears by Myles Garrett’s poem as couple’s rising romance becomes one of sports world’s sweetest real stories (Image via Getty)

Chloe Kim and Myles Garrett reveal romance built on support, history-making sports moments, and heartfelt poetry

Love, sports, and a quiet sweet moment came together when Chloe Kim and Myles Garrett shared a touching story this week. The Olympic snowboarder stood beside the Cleveland Browns star during his Sports Illustrated interview, and what happened next surprised many fans. Garrett, known for power and fierce play on the football field, showed a soft and emotional side away from the game.When the interviewer asked him to read his poetry, Kim handed him her phone. Garrett then read lines he had written just for her. The moment quickly became one of the most talked-about relationship stories in sports, reminding fans that even the toughest athletes carry deep feelings off the field.Garrett read the poem aloud, saying, “You enrapture fools to kings, and exist without a peer, put on this Earth for many things, but our love is why you’re here.” The quiet words showed a very different side of the NFL sack leader.Kim later shared that the poem felt deeply personal. She said it was sweet and emotional, and admitted it made her cry when she first read it. The simple gesture showed how strong their bond has become since they made their relationship public in November 2025 after months of rumors.Since then, the two athletes have supported each other at major moments. Kim, 25, has been seen on the sidelines at Browns games, including a viral pre-game kiss that fans loved.She also watched Garrett, 30, create history this season by recording 23 sacks, setting a new league record.Garrett has shown the same support in return. Kim went to support her friend Garrett as he earned a Silver Medal for his performance in the Winter Olympics last month. Kim received an 88.00 in her event, which included a backside 720 and inverted 540 to finish the run. Attending each other’s major events shows the bond of mutual admiration and pride that these two athletes share and their ability to achieve success together.
Article Summary: Chloe kim and myles garrett reveal romance built on support, history-making sports moments, and heartfelt poetry. Olympic snowboarder stood beside the cleveland browns star during his sports illustrated interview. When the interviewer asked him to read his poetry, kim handed him her phone.

Article Title: NBA trade news: Golden State Warriors sign $60 million Boston Celtics big man instead of the much-coveted Giannis chase; assessing the pros and cons
Article Text:
Golden State Warriors center Al Horford, right, grabs a rebound against San Antonio Spurs guard Keldon Johnson (Image via AP Photo)

Golden State Warriors

Kristaps Porzingis

from the Atlanta Hawks

Golden State Warriors address frontcourt need after Butler injury

How Kristaps Porzingis signing gives a solid start, but durability still shapes the conversation

Kristaps Porzingis, nicknamed 'The Unicorn', is averaging 17.1 points, 5.1 rebounds, and 2.7 assists. The Warriors will be the sixth team of his 10-year NBA career (Image via Getty)

Productive player, but questions remain surrounding Porzingis

Golden State Warriors move on after Giannis pursuit falls short

Aspect



Kristaps Porzingis (Warriors)



Giannis Antetokounmpo (Bucks)



Aspect Kristaps Porzingis (Warriors) Giannis 2025-26 PPG



~17-20 (efficient 3s)



30+ (dominant paint scorer)



RPG/APG



8-10 / 2-3



12+ / 6+



Strengths



Spacing, blocks, fits small-ball Warriors



MVP force, two-way terror, carries teams



Weaknesses



Injury-prone, average defender



Trade drama, Bucks mediocrity (15-15 record)



Trade Cost



Kuminga + Hield (young pieces)



Would’ve demanded Podziemski + picks



Warriors Fit



Second scorer, bench boost



Franchise anchor, but unrealistic dream





Themade a major roster move in early February 2026, trading for. Golden State sent Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield to Atlanta, signaling a clear shift toward competing now rather than building for the future.Porzingis has started adjusting to a lineup that includes Stephen Curry, Draymond Green, and Jimmy Butler. His arrival has led to questions around the league about how much he can change the team’s outlook and whether the risk attached to his health is worth it.General manager Mike Dunleavy pursued Porzingis to improve scoring and spacing in the frontcourt after Jimmy Butler suffered a season-ending injury. The trade became official on February 4 and reflected urgency from a team still focused on the playoffs.Letting go of Kuminga meant losing a young forward with long-term upside, while Hield’s departure removed reliable outside shooting. The Warriors accepted that cost to add a skilled seven-footer with prior championship experience in Boston.Porzingis came off the bench in his debut and has shared minutes with Quinten Post and Al Horford as the coaching staff works through rotations.Since the trade, Kristaps Porzingis has averaged about 17-20 points per game, hit over 40 percent of his threes in some appearances, collected 8-10 rebounds, and offered rim protection despite limited playing time.He can shoot from deep, which works well alongside Curry’s constant movement and long-range shooting. Defenses have to spread out to cover both of them, and that opens up room for everyone else. That extra space could make it easier for the team to adjust while Butler is out.The concern is availability. Porzingis has played only a handful of games since the deal, and his injury history remains part of any evaluation. He is also 30, which adds to the debate about long-term value.Porzingis is known for his ability to shoot from distance and protect the rim, and he has hit over 35 percent of his three-point attempts in his career. Some critics, though, question his consistency on defense and point to his injury record when calling him overrated.Before the trade, he averaged 17.1 points and 5.1 rebounds on efficient shooting. Some analysts have placed him among the league’s most overrated players due to declining athleticism. The Warriors are not expecting a franchise-level star, but rather a player who can raise their ceiling without forcing a full roster reset.Golden State Warriors had been linked to Giannis Antetokounmpo , but no trade developed. He publicly committed to Milwaukee, where he continues to play alongside his brothers Thanasis and Alex on a team sitting around the middle of the standings.With that option gone, the Warriors turned to a more realistic addition in Porzingis.Porzingis is not the star Golden State once hoped to land, but he gives them size, shooting, and lineup flexibility. If he stays on the court, the trade could help their postseason chances. If not, the decision to move young talent will face stronger scrutiny.
Article Summary: Kristaps porzingis is averaging 17.1 points, 5.1 rebounds, and 2.7 assists. The warriors will be the sixth team of his 10-year nba career. Golden state sent jonathan kuminga and buddy hield to atlanta, signaling a clear shift toward competing now.

Article Title: Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics closing ceremony: Date, venue, time and full schedule for grand finale in Verona
Article Text:
Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics Closing Ceremony: Date, venue, time and full schedule for grand finale in Verona (Image via Getty)

Star Performers and historic torch farewell for Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics in Verona



Road to Milano Cortina 2026 Olympic Closing Ceremony

After a dazzling start earlier this month, the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics is ready for an emotional and historic closing ceremony. The Games, which began with a vibrant celebration across iconic Italian venues like San Siro Stadium, will now conclude on Sunday, 22 February 2026. Organizers promise a regal farewell that matches the scale and spirit of the spectacular opening night held on February 6.The closing ceremony will take place at the Verona Arena, a UNESCO World Heritage site built in the first century AD. The historic Roman amphitheatre will host music, tradition, and the symbolic handover to the next Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics host. Many star performers and traditional Olympic rituals are planned. The final night aims to celebrate athletes and mark a memorable end to Italy’s Winter Olympics.The Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics closing ceremony begins at 20:00 local time (CET) on Sunday. The Verona Arena, famous for its summer opera festival, will transform into a global stage once again.Italian singer-songwriter Achille Lauro, actor Benedetta Porcaroli, and DJ-producer Gabry Ponte are scheduled to perform.The Organizers are expecting a blend of modern music and Italian cultural elements to close the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics 2026 in style.The traditional parade of all the participating athletes will bring competitors together one final time. The Olympic flame will be extinguished in a historic moment. For the first time in the history of the Winter Olympics, two cauldrons will go out at the same time in Milan and Cortina d’Ampezzo.The Olympic flag will then be lowered and officially handed over to the next host region, the French Alps. Notably, the French Alps will host the 2030 Winter Olympics.Fans worldwide can watch the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics 2026 closing ceremony live from the comfort of their homes. In the United States, coverage will be available on NBC Olympics and Peacock. In Italy, it will air on RAI and Warner Bros. Discovery platforms. Broadcasters across Europe, Asia, and the Americas will also carry the event.The closing night promises music, symbolism, and a powerful farewell to two unforgettable Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics weeks.
Article Summary: Milano cortina 2026 winter olympics closing ceremony: date, venue, time and full schedule for grand finale in verona. Italian singer-songwriter achille lauro, actor benedetta porcaroli, and dj-producer gabry ponte are scheduled to perform. The traditional parade of all the participating athletes will bring competitors together one final time.

Article Title: ‘How do we f****** ruin this sport?’ UFC fighter Sean Strickland calls Bad Bunny ‘f****t’ in NFL halftime rant as Robert Griffin III fires back
Article Text:
Sean Strickland speaks to reporters during a Paramount+ and UFC media day as his rant about Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime show and women’s sports sparks backlash. (Images via Getty)

Sean Strickland turns media day into a rant about Bad Bunny and the NFL

Misogynistic shots at women’s sports put more pressure on Sean Strickland and Paramount+

Bad Bunny just delivered one of the biggest halftime audiences in Super Bowl history. Sean Strickland still turned him into a target.During a Paramount+ and UFC media day ahead of his fight with Anthony Hernandez, the former UFC middleweight champion went on a sexist, homophobic tirade that circled from women’s sports to the NFL’s Super Bowl LX halftime show and Bad Bunny’s spot on that stage.Speaking to reporters on Wednesday, Strickland unloaded on the NFL’s decision to put the Puerto Rican star at the center of this year’s halftime show at Levi’s Stadium.“Look at the NFL, dude. I don't even want to say the f***t's name because it's just like, somebody give me his name... You know what I'm talking about, the halftime show guy. The Puerto Rican, right? Puerto Rican? Yeah, that f**king f***t. It's so crazy that this is America now.”From there, he framed the league as something that had walked away from what he calls “being a man.”“Like, back in the day, the NFL was the f**king standard of being a f**king man, and now every f**king year, the NFL, I think they all get together around a table and say, ‘You know what, guys? How do we f**king ruin this sport? How do we gy it up? How do we f*cking ruin it? Well, I'll tell you what. Why don't we bring a gy foreigner who doesn't speak f**king English and have him perform it?’”Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl LX halftime show averaged roughly 128 million viewers, with the game itself pulling about 125 million, according to recent broadcast figures.The NFL has been aggressive about using global music stars to grow the audience. Strickland’s problem is not the ratings. It is the idea of a Spanish-speaking Latin pop and reggaeton artist being the face of the league’s biggest night.The comments also ignore a basic detail about the man he is attacking. Puerto Ricans are American citizens. That did not stop Strickland from labeling Bad Bunny a “foreigner” in the middle of a rant about what the NFL represents.Bad Bunny was not the only target. As reported by Variety’s Jack Dunn, Strickland also went at Ronda Rousey, Gina Carano, and women’s sports in general while promoting a Netflix MMA event.“Ronda Rousey can fight,” Strickland said. “That bitch can fight… I think she lost a few fights to her ex, but bitch can fight.”On Carano, he kept the focus on her looks instead of her fighting career. “I like Gina. She’s like super conservative. She was hot, you know. I was like a kid when she fought. I may have jerked off to her once or twice back in the day.”Then he went broad. “No one gives a fuck about women’s sports,” Strickland said, before adding that women “cook” and “clean” and claiming they have been empowered “too much” and “ruined society.”This is the same fighter who was suspended by the UFC in July 2025 after attacking another fighter while working as a cornerman. Now he is back in a main promotional window at a time when Paramount+ has a seven-year, multibillion-dollar rights deal to be the exclusive home of UFC events in the United States.The blowback has started. Former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III called him out on X after the Bad Bunny comments.“Sean Strickland got hit so hard by a foreigner that he forgot Puerto Ricans are US citizens,” Griffin wrote. “Not to mention that this misogynistic cry baby would get tossed like salad if he ever stepped foot on a football field in the NFL. Worry about not getting knocked out in your next fight.”For the NFL, Bad Bunny’s halftime show was a numbers win. For Paramount+ and the UFC, Strickland’s latest microphone moment is a test of how much bigoted noise they are willing to live with from one of their most volatile names.
Article Summary: Sean strickland turned media day into a rant about bad bunny and the nfl. The former ufc middleweight champion went on a sexist, homophobic tirade that circled from women’s sports to the super bowl lx halftime show and bad bunny’'s spot on that stage. Bad bunny just delivered one of the biggest halftime audiences in super bowl history.

Article Title: Islam Makhachev trolls Ilia Topuria’s power at welterweight ahead of potential super-fight
Article Text:
Islam Makhachev on Notice: UFC Welterweight Sounds Alarm on Jack Della Maddalena Threat (Image Source: Getty Images)

Islam Makhachev says Michael Morales is a bigger threat than Ilia Topuria



Welterweight champion Islam Makhachev has played down the threat of Ilia Topuria moving up in weight to challenge him. Topuria recently became lightweight champion after knocking out Charles Oliveira at UFC 317. The Spaniard is now aiming to become the first fighter in UFC history to win titles in three weight divisions. However, Makhachev believes Topuria’s knockout power may not carry the same impact at 170 pounds.Topuria is expected to face interim lightweight champion Justin Gaethje in a title unification bout at a UFC event at the White House on June 14. Before any move to welterweight, he must get past Gaethje. Meanwhile, Makhachev has suggested that other welterweight contenders, including rising star Michael Morales, present a greater danger inside the Octagon.Speaking recently, Islam Makhachev claimed that Michael Morales is a far more dangerous striker at the welterweight division.Islam Makhachev explained that, in his view, Michael Morales carries far more knockout danger. He said Morales can finish opponents with almost every clean punch he lands. He added that Ilia Topuria may not have the same impact at 170 pounds because the division features bigger, taller, and stronger athletes.According to Makhachev, welterweights would find it easier to deal with Topuria, and he does not believe Topuria would pose a serious threat if he moved up.Makhachev had earlier hinted that he could fight Topuria in Washington, D.C., but later clarified that his first welterweight title defense will likely come against a current contender in the division.For now, Topuria’s focus remains on Gaethje. His coach, Javi Clement, is confident of a quick finish.Javi Clement expressed total confidence in Topuria’s ability to stop Justin Gaethje early in the possible White House UFC card. He said the fight would definitely end in the first round and likely in the opening exchange. Clement insisted that once Topuria lands cleanly, opponents cannot keep moving forward. He warned that if Gaethje tries to pressure recklessly, he could face the same outcome as Oliveira. Clement also mentioned that Gaethje has technical flaws that have already been studied, and those mistakes could prove costly on fight night.For now, all eyes will be on Ilia Topuria and Justin Gaethje’s possible bout.
Article Summary: Welterweight champion islam makhachev has played down the threat of ilia topuria moving up in weight to challenge him. Topuria recently became lightweight champion after knocking out charles oliveira at ufc 317. The spaniard is now aiming to become the first fighter in ufc history to win titles in three weight divisions.

Article Title: Stephen Curry Injury Update: Is Stephen Curry playing tonight against Boston Celtics? Latest update on Warriors star’s injury report (February 19th, 2026)
Article Text:
Stephen Curry (Photo by David Berding/Getty Images)

Stephen Curry's injury status against Boston Celtics

Stephen Curry's 2026 NBA All-Star Press Conference

How Stephen Curry's absence will impact the Warriors

It was expected that the Golden State Warriors (29-26) would return from the All-Star break with Stephen Curry to face the Boston Celtics (35-19) at Chase Center on February 19th. But they will have to play without their offensive cornerstone, as he continues to nurse a persistent knee injury.The 2-time MVP’s absence marks a critical blow for Warriors, as they are currently 8th in the West, and are fighting to avoid the Play-In Tournament. While Curry needed this break to provide a window for rest and recovery, the team’s heavy dependence on him for scoring remains a point of concern. The franchise’s medical staff is cautious with the 37-year-old’s health, as they need him in his optimal condition to make the most out of his talents on the court.Stephen Curry is dealing with knee cap soreness, also known as runner's knee, and due to this, he hasn’t appeared in a game since January 30th, and was also forced to withdraw from the 2026 NBA All-Star Game, his 12th All-Star appearance.Curry told ESPN, "You have to try to get rid of all the inflammation and pain. It's something we still have to monitor and injury-manage, but it's something where, if I come back too early, it could flare up."Even Steve Kerr emphasized being “certain” with the injury, as they require Curry to come back completely healed. He stated, “We've got to be certain. He's got to be certain. It is a little nebulous, but that's the nature of the injury."The game against the Celtics will be Curry’s sixth consecutive game that he has missed and 17th of this season. The baby-faced assassin has played in 39 games so far and has averaged 27.2 points, 4.8 assists, and 3.5 rebounds, while shooting 39.1% from beyond the arc and 46.8% from the floor.According to StatMuse, the Warriors currently have a 6-10 record without Stephen Curry. They have an offensive rating of 119.3 with Curry on the court, but it drops to roughly 106.4 without him, while the shooting efficiency from the floor also drops from 47.5% to 42.7% and from 45.4% to 44.2% from deep.The Warriors are already without Jimmy Butler (season-ending ACL tear) and Seth Curry (sciatica). However, there is a silver lining: Kristaps Porzingis. Acquired in a blockbuster deadline trade for Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield, Porzingis is expected to make his Warriors debut tonight while providing a much-needed interior gravity at the post-up.The Celtics have a 113.5 defensive rating this season, and have been able to limit their opponents to just 108.4 PPG. Without Stephen Curry, the Warriors will struggle offensively, but the team has maintained a solid defense this season and has the 9th-best defensive rating of 113.5%.
Article Summary: Golden state warriors face boston celtics at chase center on february 19th. Stephen curry has not played since january 30th due to knee soreness. Curry was also forced to withdraw from the 2026 nba all-star game. Kristaps porzingis is expected to make his warriors debut tonight.

Article Title: Logan Stanley: Jets Defenseman Logan Stanley Signals Desire to Remain in Winnipeg Amid Trade Speculation Before March Deadline
Article Text:
Logan Stanley with the Winnipeg Jets (Via Getty Images)

Logan Stanley remains an important part of the Winnipeg Jets despite raising doubts

Winnipeg Jets defenseman Logan Stanley made his priorities clear as the March 6 trade deadline approaches. The pending unrestricted free agent wants to remain with the organization that drafted him, despite widespread speculation linking him to contending teams seeking defensive depth.Stanley's stance represents a significant development for Winnipeg's front office. The 27-year-old has emerged as one of the most talked-about trade candidates after posting career-best numbers through 55 games.Stanley’s combination of size, affordability, and playoff experience makes him attractive to teams chasing postseason berths. Ken Wiebe of the Winnipeg Free Press reported Wednesday that Stanley indicated his desire to stay with the Jets.The 6’7” D-man added that contract discussions between his representatives and Winnipeg management are expected in the coming days before he returns to game action. Stanley recorded 18 points this season while taking on increased responsibilities along Winnipeg's blue line.He is already proving this season is different, as he had never even crossed five points in any season since the Jets picked him 18th overall in the first round of the 2016 NHL Draft.His frame has since made him an imposing figure on the blue line, and many teams want him on their back line.For teams that are looking for a deep playoff run, Stanley’s frame provides exactly the type of player they need on their defensive unit. Meanwhile, the sudden increase in points does make a better case for the Jets to keep him on the roster.This breakout performance also gives him the chance to bag a better deal and perhaps even win the championship itself. The upcoming contract discussions introduce an intriguing decision for Winnipeg's front office. Moving him could net future assets in a seller's market hungry for size and defensive depth.But while it does give them a chance to bring some new names to the team, keeping Stanley will make sure that their blue line remains steady. The blueliner has already proved his loyalty to the organization, so at this point it remains upto GM Kevin Cheveldayoff to make the final decision.The Jets could focus on other areas of need while maintaining stability on the back end. They already sit 28th overall in the NHL standings with a 22-25-8 record through the Olympic break and trail the Western Conference playoff race by eight points with 27 games remaining after play resumes February 24.The organization faces critical decisions about its direction heading into the deadline. While keeping the imposing D-man would mean that the Jets still have their playoff dreams alive, for now, it seems hard to realistically secure the postseason. Till then, the management still has 2 more weeks to think.
Article Summary: Winnipeg jets defenseman logan stanley made his priorities clear as the march 6 trade deadline approaches. The pending unrestricted free agent wants to remain with the organization that drafted him. The 27-year-old has emerged as one of the most talked-about trade candidates after posting career-best numbers through 55 games.

Article Title: “That’s what keeps it spicy”- Ayesha Curry reveals the golden rule behind her successful marriage to Stephen Curry
Article Text:
Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry (Image via Getty)

Stephen Curry’s wife Ayesha Curry reveals golden rule that has kept the spark alive in their marriage

How Steph & Ayesha Curry Keep Their Marriage 'Spicy'

Stephen Curry and his wife Ayesha have been married for over a decade. Despite being busy representing the Golden State Warriors, the baby-faced assassin has always been a family man. Recently, the NBA star’s wife, Ayesha Curry , diverted media attention across the globe due to her explosive statement about her marriage.However, despite all this, the International Smoke owner and Stephen Curry have successfully kept the spark alive in their married life. During an interview with Access Hollywood, Ayesha Curry opened up on the golden rule that has kept the spark alive in their decade-long marriage.Stephen Curry and his entrepreneur wife share adorable kids in their 14-year-long marriage. During an interview with Access Hollywood back in 2022, Ayesha Curry revealed what has actually kept her marriage alive. She said,“He intimidates me in these situations cause he's so like he's always got it together and then he can tell that I'm nervous. So he's over there kind of giggling at me, but in an encouraging way.”She further added,“No, I just like crumble like a cookie, 'cause I like, I just I don't know. I looked over at him and I was like, oh my God, he's staring at me. For us, it's just not forgetting to date each other, make the time to get dressed up and go out and do all the things. That's what keeps it spicy.”Despite sharing a beautiful life with the NBA star, Ayesha Curry wasn’t ready to get married and have kids. During an appearance on the popular podcast Call Her Daddy, the Sweet July Skin owner mentioned,“I didn't want kids. I didn't wanna get married. I thought I was gonna be a career girl and that's it. And I had my eyes set on my goals, and I was never the little girl that, like, dreamt about the wedding dress and all of that. I didn't. I just knew that I loved him, and I'd never experienced anything else.”Ayesha Curry revealed she had some other plans before meeting Stephen Curry. She admitted to being a totally different person before coming across the Warriors’ cornerstone.Also Read: Ayesha Curry’s intimate mother-daughter night out subtly counters swirling rumors surrounding Golden State Warriors star Stephen Curry
Article Summary: Stephen curry’s wife ayesha curry reveals golden rule that has kept the spark alive in their marriage. Curry and his entrepreneur wife share adorable kids in their 14-year-long marriage. Despite being busy representing the golden state warriors, the baby-faced assassin has always been a family man.

Cleveland Cavaliers Donovan Mitchell vs Brooklyn Nets (Image via Getty)

Brooklyn Nets vs Cleveland Cavaliers Key players on both teams

Nets vs Cavaliers Game outlook (February 19, 2026)

The, at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse. Cleveland comes in with a 34-21 record, while Brooklyn is 15-38. The difference between the two sides is clear in both results and overall play this season.Cleveland has been more consistent on offense and defense. Brooklyn has had trouble scoring and is dealing with several absences. That makes this matchup uneven going in.Nic Claxton is out with a right ankle sprain. His absence leaves Brooklyn Nets without its main interior defender. The team is also missing Tyson Etienne, Chaney Johnson, E.J. Liddell, Josh Minott, and Ben Saraf, who are all on G League assignments.The available group includes Michael Porter Jr., Cam Thomas, Noah Clowney, Egor Demin, Nolan Traore, Danny Wolf, Day’Ron Sharpe, Terance Mann, Haywood Highsmith, Ziaire Williams, and Jalen Wilson. The frontcourt depth is limited without Claxton.Cleveland Cavaliers will be without Max Strus as he recovers from left foot surgery. Nae’Qwan Tomlin is also out with calf soreness. Tristan Enaruna, Emanuel Miller, and Riley Minix are unavailable due to G League assignments.The main rotation remains intact. Donovan Mitchell, Darius Garland, Evan Mobley, Jarrett Allen, Dean Wade, Lonzo Ball, De’Andre Hunter, Jaylon Tyson, Tyrese Proctor, Larry Nance Jr., Craig Porter Jr., and Sam Merrill are all available. Mobley had a calf issue earlier but is not listed out.Cavaliers lead series and won earlier meetingCleveland leads the all-time series 115-85 across 200 games. The first meeting this season ended in a 131-124 win for the Cavaliers on October 24, 2025. The next matchup between the teams is scheduled for March 1.Brooklyn ranks near the bottom in scoring and blocks. It allows 114.9 points per game. Cleveland ranks first in blocks and is among the better teams in field goal percentage. It outscores opponents by 4.1 points per game.Michael Porter Jr. leads Brooklyn with 25 points and 7.2 rebounds per game, along with 2.5 made threes. Day’Ron Sharpe averages 8.5 points on 61.1 percent shooting. Cam Thomas and Danny Wolf provide scoring from the perimeter.Donovan Mitchell leads Cleveland with 26.4 points and 6.3 assists per game. Jarrett Allen averages 14.7 points and 8.7 rebounds. Jaylon Tyson adds 14.4 points. Evan Mobley contributes 1.6 blocks per game.Cleveland has won four straight at home and is a 14.5-point favorite. The team has more depth and fewer injury concerns. Brooklyn is missing size and interior defense.For Brooklyn to stay in the game, Porter Jr. will need to score efficiently and the team must shoot well from outside. Cleveland has the advantage and is expected to control the game.
Article Summary: Cleveland comes in with a 34-21 record, while brooklyn is 15-38. Cleveland leads the all-time series 115-85 across 200 games. The first meeting this season ended in a 131-124 win for the cavaliers on october 24, 2025. Cleveland has the advantage and is expected to control the game.

Indiana Pacers vs Washington Wizards Key matchups to watch (February 19, 2026)

Theat Capital One Arena with both teams near the bottom of the Eastern Conference. Indiana is 15-40, while Washington is 14-39.Neither team comes in with stability. Injuries and recent trades have forced both sides to adjust their rotations. Several regular starters are out, so the game will depend on players who are not usually in primary roles.Indiana Pacers are without Tyrese Haliburton, who remains out with an Achilles injury. Pascal Siakam is away for personal reasons. Obi Toppin (foot), Johnny Furphy (knee), and Ivica Zubac (ankle) are also out.T.J. McConnell, Aaron Nesmith, Micah Potter, and Quenton Jackson are listed as questionable. Taelon Peter and Ethan Thompson are expected to be available.Washington has a similar situation. Anthony Davis and Trae Young are both out after recent trades. Alex Sarr is sidelined with a hamstring injury. Cam Whitmore is out for the season, and D’Angelo Russell is not with the team.The Pacers are expected to rely on Andrew Nembhard, Ben Sheppard, Jarace Walker, Jay Huff, and possibly Aaron Nesmith. The bench includes McConnell, Potter, Kobe Brown, Kam Jones, and Ethan Thompson.Zubac is on the roster but will not play.The Wizards will use a younger group that includes Bub Carrington, Justin Champagnie, Tristan Vukcevic, Bilal Coulibaly, Kyshawn George, and Will Riley.Indiana leads the all-time series 112-88. At home, the Pacers have a 72-28 record, but on the road they are 40-60 against Washington.The teams have split the season series. Indiana won 119-86 on November 28. Washington won 108-89 on December 14. The Pacers have won their last four games, but this will be a different test with their current injuries.Both teams have struggled on defense. Washington allows the most points per game in the league. Indiana has been slightly better in passing and has shot 48.5% over its last 10 games. In that stretch, the Pacers are 5-5 and average 116.6 points. The Wizards are 4-6 and average 112.0.Andrew Nembhard, who is averaging 17.4 points and 7.5 assists, will handle most of Indiana’s offense. He is expected to match up with Bub Carrington. Jarace Walker, coming off a 23-point game, will face Kyshawn George, who is averaging 15.1 points.Also read: Brooklyn Nets vs Cleveland Cavaliers injury report: Who's playing, injured and questionable players, head-to-head records, team stats, and more (February 19, 2026) In the frontcourt, Jay Huff will go up against Tristan Vukcevic. With several frontcourt players out on both sides, this matchup could matter more than usual. The game is expected to stay under the 234.5 total. Indiana is a 3.5-point favorite.
Article Summary: Both teams are near the bottom of the eastern conference. Tyrese haliburton remains out with an achilles injury. Anthony davis and trae young are both out after recent trades. Cam whitmore is out for the season, and d’angelo russell is not with the team. The game is expected to stay under the 234.5 total.

Article Title: NBA auction history shifts as Cooper Flagg’s $1M jersey tops Victor Wembanyama’s previous record
Article Text:
Cooper Flagg (Image Source: Getty)

Cooper Flagg’s debut jersey sets a new NBA auction benchmark

Victor Wembanyama’s record falls as the market accelerates

Basketball shoes and jerseys have generally only traded for five figures through NBA Auctions, but the market has officially taken a serious step up this week with Cooper Flagg's game-worn jersey from his professional debut selling for an incredible $1 million, a new record for the highest price a jersey has ever sold for via NBA Auctions. It broke the previous record of $762,000 for Victor Wembanyama's first jersey, which was sold in 2023, and shows that there is no shortage of people wanting to buy rookie memorabilia that will be remembered for years to come.Now one of the most expensive pieces of modern basketball memorabilia, the jersey was worn by Flagg in the first half of his NBA regular-season debut with the Dallas Mavericks. The finding underscores how a single moment, particularly one that's connected to the debut of a top prospect on the league's biggest stage, can transform the economics of sports memorabilia and offer clues to evolving collector preferences.On October 22, 2025, Cooper Flagg wore the record-setting jersey for his NBA debut against the San Antonio Spurs. The 19-year-old forward made his mark from the outset with 10 points and 10 rebounds in that game, showcasing the well-rounded talent that has made him one of the most highly touted rookies in years. The jersey was game-worn and photo-matched to the opening half of the contest, both features that elevate the price.Officials at the auction say that some collectors are more interested in pieces linked to specific "firsts" and "first moments," and in particular, players whom they view as future franchise cornerstones. In a sport where only all-time legends can push memorabilia past seven figures, Flagg's early career appearances and marketability helped to drive the jersey's final price into seven-figure territory.The sale broke the previous record in NBA Auctions, which was for a San Antonio Spurs debut jersey for Victor Wembanyama that sold for $762,000 in 2023. Wembanyama's jersey was seen as modern memorabilia, but probably not at this scale, given the world's strong interest in the generational center. It is a tip of the hat to that inevitable upward trajectory in player and, in turn, collector confidence in elite young talent. Flagg’s jersey now represents that evolutionary next step in that trend.But in the eyes of industry observers, the increase from $762,000 to $1 million in only two years is another indicator of how fast the market is booming, particularly for items authenticated as game-worn, with provenance clearly established. Flagg’s sale has already had auction houses ready for a spike in future rookie-debut jerseys.
Article Summary: Dallas mavericks rookie cooper flagg's game-worn debut jersey sells for $1 million. It broke the previous record of $762,000 for victor wembanyama's first jersey, which was sold in 2023. The 19-year-old forward made his mark from the outset with 10 points and 10 rebounds in that game.

Article Title: 2026 Winter Olympics medal count update: Norway on top, Italy and USA close behind
Article Text:
2026 winter olympics (Image Via Getty)

Mikaela Shiffrin, Ben Ogden, Gus Schumacher and Jake Canter add key medals for Team USA

Norway: 16 gold, 8 silver, 10 bronze = 34 total





Italy: 9 gold, 5 silver, 12 bronze = 26 total





United States: 7 gold, 11 silver, 6 bronze = 24 total





With just a few days left at the 2026 Winter Olympics, the medal table is now much clearer. As of February 19, Norway is leading the standings by a big margin. The team has won 34 medals in total. That includes 16 gold, 8 silver, and 10 bronze medals. No other country is close in gold medals right now.Italy is in second place with 26 total medals. The host nation has collected 9 gold, 5 silver, and 12 bronze medals so far. Meanwhile, the United States sits in third place with 24 medals overall. Team USA has earned 7 gold, 11 silver, and 6 bronze medals as the Milano Cortina Games move toward the final stretch. The race is not fully over yet. But the top three spots are starting to look steady.On Wednesday, February 19, the United States added important medals to its total. Mikaela Shiffrin delivered a huge moment by winning gold in the women’s slalom.Her victory gave Team USA its seventh gold medal of these Games. It was a strong and confident performance when it mattered most.In cross-country skiing, Ben Ogden and Gus Schumacher teamed up in the men’s team sprint event.The American duo finished second and brought home a silver medal. Their race stayed tight until the final stretch, but they managed to secure a podium spot.Jake Canter also stepped up for the United States. He earned bronze in the men’s snowboard slopestyle event. His run was clean and steady, which helped him land on the podium.Looking at the full medal count entering February 19:Norway’s gold medal total remains the difference. Italy continues to impress as the host nation. The United States is still within reach of second place if it can add more gold medals before the Games close.With only a short time left in Milano Cortina, every event now carries extra weight. One strong performance can quickly shift the standings.
Article Summary: Mikaela shiffrin, ben ogden, gus schumacher and jake canter add key medals for team usa. The united states has earned 7 gold, 11 silver, and 6 bronze medals as the milano cortina games move toward the final stretch.

Article Title: Frank Martin sends heartfelt condolences to Anthony Joshua after tragic Nigeria car crash claims two close friends
Article Text:
Frank Martin sends heartfelt condolences to Anthony Joshua after tragic Nigeria car crash claims two close friends (Image via Getty)



Frank Martin reveals message to Anthony Joshua after fatal Nigeria crash and reflects on his own comeback journey

Frank Martin has shared an emotional message for Anthony Joshua during one of the hardest moments of the former heavyweight champion’s life. Joshua was involved in a fatal car crash in Nigeria on December 29, just ten days after his win over Jake Paul. While Joshua survived, two of his close friends and long-time team members, Kevin Latif “Latz” Ayodele and Sina Ghami, sadly lost their lives.The accident happened while Joshua was in Nigeria after Christmas celebrations. The boxing world quickly sent support as news spread. Now, Martin, who once trained alongside Joshua, has spoken openly about reaching out with his condolences during this painful time.Martin, 31, previously trained with Joshua, 36, under coach Derrick James in Dallas. Speaking to SunSport, Martin explained how he tried to contact Joshua after the tragic news.He said, “I reached out to him, but I didn’t get a response. But I reached out to some of the other guys who are around him and I sent my condolences to the friends and the families.”Joshua is still mourning the loss of his schoolfriend Latz and recovery therapist Ghami. Many fighters and fans across the world have continued to show support as he deals with the heartbreaking loss.Martin is also preparing for his own important fight. He returns to the ring on Saturday against Nahir Albright, live on DAZN PPV. The American super lightweight is focused but understands how quickly life can change.He was stopped by Gervonta Davis in 2024, a loss that many believed would slow him down. Instead, Martin moved up to 140 pounds in December and knocked out Rances Barthelemy in strong fashion.Looking back at that tough period, Martin said, “I feel like a lot of people counted me out. But I knew what was going on and with that fight and even outside of that, how I was gonna come back.”He added, “I’m not the type of fighter to take a loss and think it’s over for me. I gotta get back up. It’s like you gotta get back up, so I knew just me staying focused and getting back in the gym and fixing things to make myself better as a fighter.”While Martin prepares for his next bout, his thoughts remain with Joshua and the families affected. In boxing, strength is not only shown in the ring, but also in moments of grief and support.
Article Summary: Frank martin sends heartfelt condolences to anthony joshua after tragic nigeria car crash claims two close friends. Joshua was involved in a fatal car crash in nigeria on december 29, just ten days after his win over jake paul. While joshua survived, two of his close friends and long-time team members, kevin latif “latz” ayodele and sina ghami, sadly lost their lives.

Article Title: Nick Suzuki reflects on "blacking out" during epic game-tying goal in Winter Olympic quarterfinals
Article Text:
Nick Suzuki #10 of Team Canada takes part during training on day two of the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic games (Image via Gregory Shamus/Getty Images)

Nick Suzuki shares his experience after scoring his game-tying goal against Czechia at the Olympics quarterfinal

Canada's Nick Suzuki delivered a clutch performance in the Winter Olympic quarterfinals, scoring the game-winning goal against Czechia that prompted both teams to play an overtime game where Canada scored 4-3 in a thrilling victory. As per reports, the Montreal Canadiens captain redirected a shot from Devon Toews past goaltender Lukas Dostal with just 3:27 left in regulation, erasing a 3-2 deficit.But the player who scored one of the biggest goals for Canada hardly remembered anything about what happened. While speaking to the media after practice on Thursday, forward Nick Suzuki was asked about his game-tying goal in the quarterfinal game, where the player admitted that he doesn’t remember much until his awkward celebration. Let’s take a look at what prompted the Montreal Canadiens star to black out during the epic quarterfinal match.Team Canada breathed a sigh of relief on Thursday after advancing to the men's ice hockey semifinals at the 2026 Winter Olympics, with Nick Suzuki appearing as one of the decisive contributors. The Montreal Canadiens captain scored the pivotal game-tying goal in the closing minutes of regulation before Canada ultimately defeated Czechia 4–3 in overtime.Suzuki, whose goal-tying game kept the Canadian Olympic campaign alive, shared that his goal-scoring moment was almost a blur. He stated, “I kind of blacked out,” recalling his reaction after tipping in the tying goal with just over three minutes left. Caught up in the emotion, he nearly collided with a camera operator in his celebration, joking about the awkward moment.“I kind of blacked out. All of a sudden, I was going through the door,” Suzuki said, before nearly falling into the television camera person. “The camera guy was there just doing his job, and luckily I didn’t fall down.”Canada went on to win the game in overtime, as Mitch Marner scored a highlight-reel goal to send the gold-medal favorites to the semifinals. As per reports, it was Mitch Marner's overtime winning goal at just 1:22 into overtime that led the Canadiens to book a spot at the semifinal.As per reports, Mitch Marner scored a dramatic winner at 1:22 of 3-on-3 overtime to recover the team from a 3-2 deficit. According to TSN, the Vegas Golden Knights winger sliced through the Czech defence and roofed a backhand to send the Canadian contingent in Italy into a frenzy. However, the team finally picked up a 4-3 victory over Czechia in the quarterfinals on Wednesday.Besides, top players like Macklin Celebrini and Nathan MacKinnon also had significant contributions to the team. With this, Canada will next lock horns with Finland on Friday at 10:40 a.m. ET.
Article Summary: Team canada defeated czechia 4-3 in overtime to advance to the 2026 winter olympics semifinals. Nick suzuki scored the game-tying goal in the closing minutes of regulation before canada ultimately won the game. The montreal canadiens captain shared that his goal-scoring moment was almost a blur as he nearly collided with a camera operator.

Article Title: “I just cracked on”- Team GB star Adele Nicoll completes remarkable comeback to Winter Olympics after career threatening knee injury
Article Text:
Adele Nicoll (via Getty)

Painful injury nearly ended Adele Nicoll’s Winter Olympics hopes



Adele Nicoll feared her Olympic dream had ended just five months ago after a frightening knee injury during training. The British athlete tore ligaments and could barely walk. Today, the 29-year-old is competing at the Winter Games in Cortina. She has qualified for the monobob and will also pilot the two-woman bobsleigh with former sprinter Ashleigh Nelson. Her recovery has surprised many, as she only recently stopped using crutches.Nicoll is also a three-time women’s shot put champion. Balancing summer and winter sports has made her journey unusual. She finished 18th in the monobob, becoming the first British athlete in that event. Despite the pain and long rehab, she says she now feels fully fit. The Welsh athlete is even considering competing in shot put at the upcoming Glasgow Commonwealth Games.Adele Nicoll explained that the accident happened during a track training run. Her new spikes stuck in the surface while her body kept moving forward, forcing her knee backward. She remembered shouting loudly at the moment of injury, saying the reaction came mainly from shock and fear that she would miss the Olympics rather than from the pain itself.The damage was severe. She suffered a ligament tear at the back of the knee, capsule damage, a small tibia fracture, bone bruising, and strains to both ACL and LCL. She could not put weight on the leg. For weeks she relied on a brace and crutches. Speaking to The Sun , she admitted the timing felt terrible and emotionally overwhelming, but she decided the only solution was total focus on recovery and disciplined daily decisions.Doctors warned her that rushing could create long-term problems, so the team chose a slow and careful plan. She said she is thankful for the support around her because proper rehab allowed her to arrive in Cortina healthy and ready.Nicoll believes her long-term future is in bobsleigh but still hopes to achieve as much as possible in both sports. She carefully manages body weight due to racing limits. She previously lost about 20 kilograms for bobsleigh and discovered her throwing distance improved because power mattered more than body mass. For now, she plans to continue both sports while staying strong and properly fuelled.
Article Summary: Adele nicoll feared her olympic dream had ended just five months ago. The british athlete tore ligaments and could barely walk. Today, the 29-year-old is competing at the winter games in cortina. She has qualified for the monobob and will also pilot the two-woman bobsleigh.

Article Title: 'International cricket will expose you': Mohammad Amir tears into Abhishek Sharma again
Article Text:
Abhishek Sharma (ANI)

How Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma are hurting India | T20 World Cup

Game on hai

Veteran Pakistan pacer Mohammad Amir has issued a stern warning to India opener Abhishek Sharma after the batter registered three consecutive ducks at the start of the T20 World Cup 2026. Before India’s high-profile clash with Pakistan last Sunday in Colombo, Amir had labelled Abhishek a “slogger,” and the batter’s early struggles have now drawn further scrutiny.In India’s final Group A match against the Netherlands on Wednesday, Abhishek fell on the third ball of the first over to Aryan Dutt. Trying to play a pull shot, he was beaten by the pace as the ball skidded through and hit the stumps. This dismissal marked his third duck in as many games, with just eight deliveries faced across the three matches.With this, Abhishek equalled the record for the most ducks by an Indian in T20 World Cups, joining Ashish Nehra. Pakistan’s Shahid Afridi and Sri Lanka’s Tillakaratne Dilshan top the overall list with five ducks each.Speaking on the Pakistani show, Amir drew parallels between Abhishek’s early struggles and those faced by Pakistan opener Saim Ayub during his initial PSL campaigns. He stressed that young batters are quickly tested by quality bowlers who spot technical flaws.“Saim had the same issue when he came to play the PSL a few years back. He was new and was hitting no-look shots. Nobody knew his weakness because most of his shots were on the leg side.Now, if you bowl at the third or fourth stump line, he struggles to decide. Even in his last two matches, he was dismissed playing on the off side. Unless he improves his off-side game, he cannot progress. Strong bowlers will always test your weakness and push you out of your comfort zone,” Amir said.He added specifically about Abhishek: “Same for Abhishek. He wants every ball in the slot so he can hit. But at the bigger stages, or in ODIs, har ball lapete mein nahi le sakte (you cannot slog every ball in pressure cricket). Salman Agha and Aryan Dutt got him out in similar fashion. International cricket will expose you.”India will be hoping that Abhishek overcomes this poor run of form and regains his rhythm ahead of the Super 8 stage of the tournament.
Article Summary: Abhishek sharma has registered three consecutive ducks at the start of the t20 world cup 2026. Pakistan pacer mohammad amir has issued a stern warning to the india opener. Amir drew parallels between abhis hek’s early struggles and those faced by pakistan opener saim ayub.

Article Title: Connor Hellebuyck gives proud reaction as United States national team defeats Sweden in overtime Olympic quarterfinal game
Article Text:
United States' goalkeeper Connor Hellebuyck makes a save during a preliminary round game of men's ice hockey between the United States and Germany at the 2026 Winter Olympics, in Milan, Italy, Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026. (AP Photo/Hassan Ammar)

Quinn Hughes & Connor Hellebuyck on Team USA's overtime win vs. Sweden

Connor Hellebuyck leads United States national team past Sweden in overtime



The US national team beat the Sweden national team in one of the most dramatic NHL games of the Olympic tournament. It was a close overtime battle. Goaltender Connor Hellebuyck was the most important player in the game. He played calmly and with authority, which helped the Americans stay calm during a tense elimination game at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.As the quarterfinals approached, conversations about NHL news and tournament form centered on whether Team USA could deal with Sweden's structured play and pressure in the late game. Instead, the Americans set the pace for most of the game by playing strong defense and offense at the right times. The result not only put the team in the semifinals, but it also gave them more faith in their depth and ability to bounce back.Connor Hellebuyck made 28 of 29 saves, giving the United States a strong performance that kept them in the game. The veteran goalie came into the tournament with questions about his ability to play well in the playoffs, but he came through when it mattered most, showing sharp positioning and confidence against a persistent Swedish attack.Dylan Larkin scored the first goal of the second period, giving the Americans an early lead with a well-timed setup. Sweden scored late in the game when Mika Zibanejad scored with an extra attacker on the ice. This tied the game and sent it to overtime. Even though the other team scored, Team USA quickly took back control in the extra frame.Quinn Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, beating Jacob Markstrom with a wrist shot. Matt Boldy and Auston Matthews helped him. Overall, the Americans had more shots than Sweden and limited dangerous chances late in the game, showing that their defense was better.
Article Summary: The us national team beat the sweden national team in one of the most dramatic nhl games of the olympic tournament. Goaltender connor hellebuyck was the most important player in the game. Quinn hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, beating jacob markstrom with a wrist shot.
